summary:
“Originally from three continents, countries, and cultures, and having grown up in multicultural environments across the globe, my encounters abroad have taught me the importance of optimism, stepping out of my comfort zone and immersion; diversity and access to such a vibrant lifestyle have given many life experiences that I truly treasure, honing numerous transferable skills.”

Isabel Pieterson is a seventeen-year-old, detail-oriented, high school student who is currently undertaking the International Baccalaureate Diploma Program at United World College in Maastricht.

Isabel is involved in both her school's community and the greater community: having worked with numerous non-profit organisations, like OnePwaa or HundrED, she is keen on advocating for lifelong learning. Furthermore, she is the Founder of 'collaborACE' - a website that offers both GCSE students and teachers the opportunity to freely view and use subject-specific notes, improving access to education amongst students; this platform has expanded internationally and, according to Google Analytics, has users from over 3 continents and 13 countries.

In 2022, Isabel authored a systematic literature review research paper, "Evaluation of Helminthic Therapy as a Treatment for Autoimmune Diseases"; which was peer-reviewed by a panel of professionals and published by 'The International Young Researchers' Conference.' (In partnership with the Columbia University Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons Global Health Organization)

In her free time, Isabel enjoys skiing, playing the piano and is captivated by storytelling. Having grown up in an international environment, she adores meeting new people, so feel free to connect with her and say "hello!" She'd love to learn more about you.

treasury_media.title: to liberate a toy.
treasury_media.description: Check out my latest poem here!

treasury_media.title: Spotlight: Formative Assessment – Improving Learning for Every Child
treasury_media.description:
Featured in a HundrED spotlight report (Page 30)

"I think formative assessments are significantly important to change education
for the better. For teachers, it allows them to immediately pick up on the
understanding of their students in a non-pressured environment. For students,
it makes learning more interactive, enjoyable and less tense..."

treasury_media.title: Can Parasites Cure? Evaluation of Helminthic Therapy as a Treatment for Autoimmune Diseases
treasury_media.description: Authored a systematic literature review on the use of helminthic therapy for treating autoimmune diseases for the IYRC (in partnership with the Columbia University Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons Global Health Organization) 2022 Research Conference. Paper was peer-reviewed and published.

treasury_media.title: What young people want you to understand about climate change
treasury_media.description: This Earth Day, we asked HundrED Youth Ambassadors Isabel, a 16-year-old from Bahrain; Alexandra Zandy, a 19-year old college student from the United States; and Olivia a 14-year-old from Australia their feelings about climate change and the education they are receiving around how to create a more sustainable future for us all. They shared their thoughts and feelings about climate change.

awards.title: Rise Finalist
awards.description:
"Rise is a program that finds promising young people and provides opportunity for life as they work to serve others. The program starts at ages 15-17 and encourages a lifetime of service and learning by providing support that includes need-based scholarships, mentorship, networking, access to career development opportunities, and the potential for additional funding as Rise Global Winners work toward solving humanity’s most pressing problems. An initiative of Schmidt Futures and the Rhodes Trust, Rise is the anchor program of a $1 billion commitment from Eric and Wendy Schmidt to find and support global talent."

• 1 of the 500 finalists chosen out of thousands of applicants
• Given the opportunity to participate in educational and social impact courses with topics ranging from artificial intelligence to professional development
• Given access to other funding opportunities

awards.title: Harvard Alumni for Global Women's Empowerment Essay Contest Winner
awards.description:
1 of the 3 recepients of the award from my school.
• Submitted a 750 word essay answering the question, “What is the biggest challenge facing women and girls in your country today?”
• Essay is judged on the chosen challenge, explaining the problems, conveying the ideas with emotional power, and identifying potential solutions
• Received recognition on the Harvard GlobalWE website, the GlobalWE Book Award and the opportunity for the essay to be published

awards.title: IYRC Vision Scholar
awards.description:
A select group of returning IYRC students can become VISION Scholars. They facilitate the student experience and provide insight into a curriculum that would appeal to students. Students check in with their peers and act as a resource for other students in the program.

Vision Scholar Components:
• Lead sustainable initiatives within the IYRC platform
• Work alongside the IYRC Directors leading up to the next conference
• Serve as a peer resource for your fellow student researchers

projects.title: S.T.E.M UP Maastricht
projects.description:
S.T.E.M UP Maastricht is the first STEM student-led open house in Maastricht, an idea brought by five Year 12 UWC Maastricht students as part of UWCM's Youth Social Entrepreneurship course. The main aim of S.T.E.M UP Maastricht is to promote the popularisation of STEM due to the limited access to STEM education among primary students in the Netherlands, particularly focusing on the Maastricht local community. We invited local schools in Maastricht to collaborate with us on - hosting STEM workshops to engage children aged 10-12, teachers, and parents.

• Hosted a day full of Biology, Chemistry, Maths, and Physics workshops, activities and experiments for children aged 10-12
• Prepared, made and gave DIY STEM kits for refugee children in the Refugee (AZC) Centre Maastricht
• Communicated with STEM-based organisations throughout the Netherlands to form collaborations (eg. GalactIQ Education, STEAM Limburg)
• Communicated with 5+ local schools within Maastricht to invite them to participate
• Focused on marketing strategies like advertising through newsletters (Weekend van de Wetenschap - 8000+ subscribers, GalactIQ - 5000+ subscribers) and Instagram

projects.title: Systematic Literature Review: “Can Parasites Cure? Evaluation of Helminthic Therapy as a Treatment for Autoimmune Diseases”
projects.description:
• The systematic literature review was peer-reviewed by a panel of professionals and published by 'The International Young Researchers' Conference' (In partnership with the Columbia University Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons Global Health Organization)
• Conducted research on the use of helminthic therapy in treating autoimmune diseases and compiled my research into a systematic literature review
• Received mentorship from a Columbia University Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons MD candidate
• Featured in my school's newsletter

projects.title: collaborACE
projects.description:
collaborACE is a website that acts as a platform for GCSE students to view a bank of subject-specific notes, offering both GCSE students and teachers the opportunity to freely view and use notes - without any charge. 

collaborACE has grown entirely organically - through organic social and referrals, receiving a profound amount of attention from platforms like TikTok. According to Google Analytics, our users come from 3 continents and over 13 countries.

At collaborACE, we advocate for equity in education (SDG 4) and are dedicated to improving access to education amongst students, hence this platform was founded and formed in July 2022 by sixteen-year-old Isabel. 

Creating a platform like collaborACE has always been a pertinent idea in Isabel's mind. As a GCSE 2022 student herself, Isabel realised that there weren't many high-quality, concise, or 'easy to understand' notes available for students and teachers - in fact, many of the notes required payment for access. collaborACE initially started off as a small summer project, as a medium to 'recycle' GCSE notes, but has now expanded internationally.

publications.name: Can Parasites Cure? Evaluation of Helminthic Therapy as a Treatment for Autoimmune Diseases
publications.publisher: The International Young Researchers' Conference (In partnership with the Columbia University Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons Global Health Organization)

volunteer_experiences.description:
• Assisted the teachers during the DRIC's children's ministry
• Responsible for making sure the children (aged 6-12) feel safe, comfortable and are having fun
• Assisted the children during craft/snack/learning activities
• Communicated with the children in both Dutch and English

• Featured and quoted in a HundrED 2021-2022 Spotlight Report (in partnership with the Jacobs Foundation) about Formative Assessment in education, offering a student’s perspective in the ‘Collection of Voices’ segment
• Co-authored an article for International Earth Day 2022

• Created a website that acts as a platform for GCSE students and teachers to view and use a bank of subject-specific notes for free as a way to aid and advocate for equity in education (SDG 4) 
• Expanded internationally: 6500+ users from 10+ countries, 3 continents
• Grown collaborACE entirely organically, through organic social and referrals, receiving profound attention from platforms like Tiktok and Reddit

• Remotely worked with 10 other members from 15 countries
• Wrote material and published, consisting of 6 case studies (Social Studies, the Arts, History and Science) and 1 study guide (Science)
• Adjudicated in the OnePwaa Online Debate Tournament during the COVID-19 period
• Successfully helped organise the 'OnePwaa Online World Scholar's Camp' with over 150 participants looking to hone their debate and writing skills. All profits from this event were reinvested into the education of underprivileged communities internationally
